{{cpp/title|strncpy}}
{{cpp/string/byte/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cstring|
char* strncpy( char* dest, const char* src, std::size_t count );
}}

Copies at most {{c|count}} characters of the byte string pointed to by {{c|src}} (including the terminating null character) to character array pointed to by {{c|dest}}. 

If {{c|count}} is reached before the entire string {{c|src}} was copied, the resulting character array is not null-terminated.

If, after copying the terminating null character from {{c|src}}, {{c|count}} is not reached, additional null characters are written to {{c|dest}} until the total of {{c|count}} characters have been written.

If the strings overlap, the behavior is undefined.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|dest|pointer to the character array to copy to}}
{{par|src|pointer to the byte string to copy from}}
{{par|count|maximum number of characters to copy}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|dest}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cstring&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    const char* src = "hi";
    char dest[6] = {'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'};
    std::strncpy(dest, src, 5);

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "The contents of dest are: ";
    for (char c : dest)
    {
        if (c)
            std::cout &lt;&lt; c &lt;&lt; ' ';
        else
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "\\0" &lt;&lt; ' ';
    }
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
The contents of dest are: h i \0 \0 \0 f 
}}
